sect1.title: KEYUNICODE

row.entry: KEYUNICODE returns a single DATA value.

sect1.para: The KEYUNICODE function returns a DATA value derived from the string parameter, such that a comparison of these data values is equivalent to a locale sensitive comparison of the Unicode values that generated them--and, being a simple memcmp(), is significantly faster. The generating string values must be of the same locale or the results are unpredictable. This function is particularly useful if you're doing a lot of compares on a UNICODE field in a large dataset--it can be a good idea to generate a key field and do the compares on that instead.
